import sqlite3
from flask import Flask, request, jsonify

app = Flask(__name__)

def get_db():
    db = getattr(Flask, '_database', None)
    if db is None:
        db = Flask._database = sqlite3.connect('incomes.db')
    return db

@app.route('/edit_income', methods=['POST'])
def edit_income():
    income_id = request.form['income_id']
    amount = request.form['amount']

    query = "UPDATE incomes SET amount = ? WHERE id = ?"
    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, [amount, income_id])
    db.commit()

    return 'Income updated successfully'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.db import connection

def update_profile(request):
    name = request.POST['name']
    bio = request.POST['bio']
    profile_pic = request.FILES['profile_pic']

    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
         query = "UPDATE users SET name = %s, bio = %s, profile_pic = %s WHERE id = %s"
        cursor.execute(query, (name, bio, profile_pic, request.user.id))

    return render(request, 'profile_updated.html')

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^profile/$', update_profile),
]

import os
import tarfile

def create_cache(cache_dir):
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk('workspace'):
        for name in files:
            full_path = os.path.join(root, name)
            rel_path = os.path.relpath(full_path, 'workspace')
            tar_path = os.path.join(cache_dir, rel_path) + '.tar'
            with tarfile.open(tar_path, 'w') as tar:
                tar.add(full_path)

create_cache('cache/')

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///bills.db'

@app.route('/get_average_bill', methods=['POST'])
def get_average_bill():
    user_id = request.form['user_id']

    query = "SELECT AVG(amount) FROM bills WHERE user_id = ?"
    connection = sqlite3.connect(app.config['DATABASE'])
    cursor = connection.cursor()
    average = cursor.execute(query, [user_id]).fetchone()[0]

    return jsonify({'average': average})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Borrower(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80))
    email = db.Column(db.String(120))
    location = db.Column(db.String(80))
    loans = db.relationship('Loan', backref='borrower', lazy=True)

@app.route('/create_borrower', methods=['POST'])
def create_borrower():
    name = request.form['name']
    email = request.form['email']
    location = request.form['location']

    query = "INSERT INTO borrower (name, email, location) VALUES (:name, :email, :location)"
    db.session.execute(query, {'name': name, 'email': email, 'location': location})
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({'status': 'success'})

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from datetime import datetime

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///borrow.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Borrow(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    lender_username = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    borrower_username = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    item_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    return_date = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)
    returned = db.Column(db.Boolean, default=False)

@app.route('/get_overdue_returns', methods=['POST'])
def get_overdue_returns():
    username = request.form['username']

    today = datetime.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')

    query = db.session.query(Borrow).filter(
      Borrow.borrower_username == username,
      Borrow.returned == False,
      Borrow.return_date < today
    )
    borrows = db.session.execute(query).fetchall()

    return jsonify(borrows)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///database.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Trip(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    description = db.Column(db.Text)

    def __repr__(self):
        return '<Trip %r>' % self.name

@app.route('/edit_trip_name', methods=['POST'])
def edit_trip_name():
    trip_id = request.form['trip_id']
    name = request.form['name']

    query = "UPDATE trips SET name = :name WHERE id = :id"
    db.session.execute(query, {'name': name, 'id': trip_id})
    db.session.commit()

    return 'Trip name updated!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run()

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config["SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL"] = "sqlite:///database.db"
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class TVShow(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)

@app.route("/add-show", methods=["POST"])
def add_show():
    name = request.form["name"]

    query = TVShow(name=name)
    db.session.add(query)
    db.session.commit()

    return jsonify({"status": "success"})
